results.title: Captain Blood
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Cosmopolitan and Michael Curtiz
results.brief_description: Peter Blood, a young doctor unjustly condemned for treating rebels is sentenced to slavery. Arabella, the beautiful niece of a cruel plantation owner, buys him, but Blood and his mates eventually escape and begin a career of piracy, gallantly fighting off adversaries on the high seas. After a strange twist of fate, Arabella and Blood meet again and justice and romance prevail. This film, with its thrilling sea battles launched the careers of Errol Flynn and Olivia de Havilland in the title roles.

results.title: Captain and kings
results.creator_credit: Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Ron Lowe
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Top end”.
The film examines why Greek immigrants settled in Darwin and their contribution to its development both socially and economically. Interviews with Greek small-businessmen and their wives are conducted about their businesses, family life and how they see themselves in both the Greek and Australian communities. Interviews with non-Greek Darwin residents are also conducted.

results.title: Caps for sale [B&W]
results.brief_description: This is a charming tale about a peddler whose stolen caps mean all kinds of monkey business. Whimsical illustrations and flighty trills of music reflect the storyteller’s words. Based on the book written and illustrated by Esphyr Slobodkina. Narrated by Esphyr Slobodkina.

results.title: Capricornia utopia
results.creator_credit: George Patterson-Noble Bartlett, Robinson-Jones and Ian Austin
results.brief_description: A film about Australian industries and manufacture in the Rockhampton region of Queensland. Outlines the social, historical, community and rural life including the Flying Doctor Service, the mining areas and Tooloa. Cast features Eric Oldfield and Sharron Fisher with narration by Don McTaggart.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Patterson-Noble Bartlett, Robinson-Jones and Ian Austin

results.title: Capricorn one
results.creator_credit: Associated General Films, Paul N Lazarus and Peter Hyams
results.brief_description: The world waits for the first manned space flight to Mars. Before the countdown ends, the three astronauts become part of an elaborate hoax designed to fool the American public. A journalist (Elliot Gould) uncovers the plot and the astronauts are plunged into a battle of wits in order to survive. Hal Holbrook plays the director of NASA who engineers the hoax, while Sam Waterston, James Brolin and O.J. Simpson play the doomed spacemen. Closer to a thriller in genre than science fiction, the film’s ingenious plot concept does not compensate for its obvious flaws such as the complete character turnaround by Holbrook, who goes from a man acting on his beliefs, to an evil genius who will stop at nothing to carry out his plot.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Associated General Films, Paul N Lazarus and Peter Hyams

results.title: Capricious summer = Rozmarne leto [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Ceskoslovensky Filmexport, Filmove Studio Barrandov, Jan Libora and Jiri Menzel
results.brief_description: At a second-rate, turn-of-the-century resort, the pool manager, an ex-mayor, and a priest spend the sleepy summer days swimming, drinking, eating and pontificating on Life in a flowery language — until an aerialist/magician and his beautiful “assistant” come to town. Each of the trio in turn becomes humiliatingly convinced that it is too late for an adventure. Based on a novel by the Czech writer Vladimir Vancura, ‘Capricious Summer’ displays the subtle atmosphere of a Jean Renoir film. A film of the Czech New Wave—an highly fertile period in Czech film history that was brutally repressed by the Soviet invasion in 1968. Cast includes Rudolf Hrusinsky, Vlastimil Brodsky, Frantisek Rehak, Mila Myslikova and Jiri Menzel as the aerialist/magician. (Award: Grand Prix, Karlovy Vary Film Festival)

results.title: Cappuccino
results.creator_credit: Archer Films, Antony J. Bowman and Sue Wild
results.brief_description: A taxi-driver yearns to be a stand-up comic. He narrates the story about a group of middle aged actors and actresses who meet regularly at an inner-city cafe to discuss their relationships and work or attempts to obtain roles. Stars John Clayton and Rowena Wallace.
